question: DC current flows in one direction, while ac current rises from zero to a maximum, then falls to zero in one direction, then rises to a maximum, then falls to zero in the opposite direction.
A square and a rectangular waveform appear to have a step voltage transition.
The duty cycle of a square wave with a pulse width of 3 s and a period of 9 s is 40%.
The rms value of a sine wave is .707 x peak-to-peak value/2.
DC current transfers better over longer distances than ac current.
An ac wave shape could be a sine wave, square wave, or sawtooth wave.
A sawtooth voltage waveform has a linear ramp that changes voltage level with respect to time.
The period of a 10 kHz sine wave is 10 s.
The average value of a sine wave is .707 times the peak value.
